Monthly Fire Weather and Burned Area Data (Simulated)

se_fire_monthly.Rd

A simulated dataset created for the Bushfire Explorer app. It mimics the relationship between Fire Weather Index (FWI) and burned area in bushfire events across different months.

Usage

se_fire_monthly

Format

A data frame with 100 rows and 3 variables:

month

Month of observation (Jan–Dec).

FWI

Fire Weather Index (higher = more dangerous fire conditions).

burned_area

Area burned (hectares, plotted as log10(burned_area)).

Source

Simulated data generated by Quanyu Qian (2025) in data-raw/make_data.R.

Details

The data are generated in data-raw/make_data.R for demonstration purposes — not from real records — and are used in the Shiny app to explore how higher FWI values are associated with larger burned areas.

Examples

# View first few rows
head(se_fire_monthly)
#>   month      FWI burned_area
#> 1   Oct 24.37888         197
#> 2   Oct 49.41526         935
#> 3   Jan 30.44885         245
#> 4   Oct 54.15087        3463
#> 5   Jan 57.02336        1387
#> 6   Oct 12.27782         205
